channel.title: Compile error lol (rep reward)
channel.description:
hey - ill make you admin in my server :P but im not like those noobs who say that and their servers suck ive had many servers and never had this error my server is actually good so you want the admin spot
i set my class path and download java 9
idk if thats right java
but i get this error in compile
[code]The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
is that what its sopposed to say?
[b]and heres whats in my compile[/b]
[code]@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\java.exe" server pause[/code]

item.title: Compile error lol (rep reward)
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

@echo off title yourservernamehere "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_10injavac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_10injava.exe" server pause

try that…

Read full topic

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ok you need to know where you saved you java files. copy that address and place it in the compiler. most people just have generic places. but some people actually put there’s somewhere.

item.title: Compile error lol (rep reward)
item.dc:creator: @br4it0ns br4it0ns
item.description:
@br4it0ns wrote:

[quote="‡¾œ¦ØÐ±‰Š¤, post:13, topic:33120"]you need to set the classpath in your computer go to my computer right-click > Properties > Advanced > Environment Variables > Go To New in the top box and set the variable name as CLASSPATH and the variable value to: SET CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.

Do the same for the bottom one and you should be fine :)[/quote]

change the 06 to 09 if u have jdk09

check to see if u have another 0# it must be 09 if you have jdk09

Read full topic

Do the same for the bottom one and you should be fine :)[/quote]

item.title: Compile error lol (rep reward)
item.dc:creator: @_oe_OD_S ‡¾œ¦ØÐ±‰Š¤
item.description:
@_oe_OD_S wrote:

You need to set the classpath in your computer go to my computer right-click > Properties > Advanced > Environment Variables > Go To New in the top box and set the variable name as CLASSPATH and the variable value to: SET CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.

Do the same for the bottom one and you should be fine

Read full topic
